definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

pinyin: lian2 bang1 jin3 ji2 cuo4 shi1 shu3

sentences.english: It was the volunteer emergency crew on the other end.
Opening the door in an emergency will automatically  inflate the evacuation slides.
sentences.chinese: 打开紧急出口的门会自动充气逃离滑梯。

sentences.english: Saved the meteorological observatory evening to issue the Zhejiang coastal area strong typhoon urgent alarm yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 省气象台昨天傍晚发布浙江沿海地区强台风紧急警报。

sentences.english: Step 6: If you cannot open the doors, look for an emergency exit window.
sentences.chinese: 如果无法打开紧急车门，则寻找太平门窗户。

sentences.english: I am a Chinese armed police soldiers, I was on duty.
sentences.chinese: 紧急啊我是一名中国武警战士，我正在值勤。

sentences.english: I will offer myself to the state as emergency arise.
sentences.chinese: 一旦发生紧急情况，我一定会为祖国献身的。

sentences.english: In an emergency, buyers under duress have no freedom.
sentences.chinese: 在紧急关头，买家迫不得已别无选择。

sentences.english: An urgent message was radioed to us this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上有条紧急消息以无线电报发给我们。

sentences.english: Three emergency evacuation route arrangement, Lin field mother but need someone to pick up from home.
sentences.chinese: 三林紧急安排撤退路线，但需有人将田母从家中接出。

sentences.english: This brake can't be banked on if we have to pull up suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们必须紧急停车，这个刹车是不可靠的。

sentences.english: The bans only affect planned caesareans, not c-sections which are carried out for emergency reasons.
sentences.chinese: 该禁令只有计划的剖腹产，紧急的剖腹产不列。

sentences.english: I have an urgent matter, please pass on to penavico, the sooner, the better.
sentences.chinese: 我有紧急事情，请接外轮代理公司，越快越好。

sentences.english: The utility of this rescue equipment has still to be assessed in a real emergency.
sentences.chinese: 这种救生设备的功用还有待在真正的紧急情况中评定。

sentences.english: Have you ever crammed for tests?
sentences.chinese: 你有过为考试紧急复习的时候吗？

sentences.english: This alarm button is only to is used in extremis.
sentences.chinese: 此警报按钮只在紧急情况下使用。

definition: at top speed/at a tremendous lick
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
to respond to an emergency/to meet a contingency/(attributive) emergency
in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing
